name: Galileo Galilei
contributions: Established projectile motion principles, showing objects fall at the same rate and describing parabolic trajectories, key to ballistics.

name: Isaac Newton
contributions: Formulated laws of motion and gravitation, providing the mathematical basis for projectile paths and forces in ballistics.

name: Benjamin Robins
contributions: Invented the ballistic pendulum and authored New Principles of Gunnery (1742), advancing external ballistics.

name: Carl Cranz
contributions: Formalized ballistics as a science with Lehrbuch der Ballistik, researching projectile dynamics extensively.

name: F.W. Lanchester
contributions: Advanced internal ballistics with gas dynamics studies, influencing modern firearm design.

name: United States Marine Corps
contributions: Developed advanced marksmanship training, setting precision and combat shooting standards for modern ballistics.
